byline.contributor: Jill Langlois contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil.

abstract: Brazilian Judge Gilmar Mendes suspends nomination of former Pres Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to cabinet post in Pres Dilma Rousseff's government, citing evidence of attempt by both to obstruct corruption investigation into da Silva's activities; move comes amid concerns that da Silva would use privileged legal status given to government figures to avoid arrest.
lead_paragraph: The ruling was the latest twist in a political crisis that has Latin America’s largest country’s on edge.

headline.main: Amid Scandals, Senior Judge in Brazil Suspends Ex-President’s Cabinet Nomination
headline.print_headline: Amid Scandals, Senior Judge in Brazil Suspends Ex-President’s Cabinet Nomination

snippet: The ruling was the latest twist in a political crisis that has Latin America’s largest country’s on edge.
